gov.nih.nlm.bioscores.agreement

Class DiscourseConnectiveAgreement

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.bioscores.agreement.DiscourseConnectiveAgreement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agreement

    public class DiscourseConnectiveAgreement
extends java.lang.Object
implements Agreement
    A limited implementation of agreement based on sentence-initial discourse connectives that indicate referents in the same sentence. It is useful for CoreferenceType.Cataphora resolution of pronominal mentions.

    Agreement is predicted if there is a sentence-initial discourse connective followed by a coreferential mention and there is a comma between the mention and the candidate referent in the sentence. It is currently limited to a few discourse connectives (because, although, since).

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • agree

        public boolean agree(CoreferenceType corefType,
                     ExpressionType expType,
                     SurfaceElement exp,
                     SurfaceElement referent)
        Description copied from interface: Agreement
        Method to implement to calculate agreement between a coreferential mention and a candidate referent.
        Specified by:
        agree in interface Agreement
        Parameters:
        corefType - the type of coreference being considered (e.g., CoreferenceType.Anaphora)
        expType - the type of coreferential mention type being considered (e.g., ExpressionType.PersonalPronoun)
        exp - the coreferential mention
        referent - the candidate referent
        Returns:
        true if the mention and the candidate agree on the criterion established by the implementing class
